episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including the negotiation of bee stings in a horror film, the use of a crash test moose by Volvo, the historical use of radioactive materials in everyday items, and the surprising connection between a former Mexican president and the introduction of chewing gum to the world.

facts.fact: The star of the film Candy Man, where a character has bees coming out of his mouth, negotiated a $1,000 bonus for every time he got stung. He ended up with $23,000.
As well as using crash test dummies, Volvo tests its cars with a crash test moose, which as far as I can tell is called moose-us.
Americans used to make their slippers radioactive so they could find them in the dark.
The man who introduced chewing gum to the world had already been president of Mexico 11 times.
